sentences.english: They cant change a light bulb or without making a sketch.
sentences.chinese: 他們連燈泡都不會換，或者至少要先畫個草圖。

sentences.english: The tolls, which include a government passage tax, varied from $4 to $30 per vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 隧道收費連政府通過稅，每程由4元至30元不等。

sentences.english: However, even resist to all tin not do it, again He Tan resists.
sentences.chinese: 然而，連抗拒都做不到，又何談反抗。
連父親都深深地被打動。

sentences.english: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.
sentences.chinese: 然而你們連一根頭髮，也必不損壞。

sentences.english: Or maybe I don't even remember that I was alive.
sentences.chinese: 甚至可能連活着都不記得。

sentences.english: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge--to the great amazement of the governor.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌仍不回答，連一句話也不說，以致巡撫甚覺希奇。

sentences.english: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌仍不回答，連一句話也不說，以致巡撫甚覺希奇。

sentences.english: John couldn't even pick up the box, much less carry it upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 約翰連這箱子提都提不起來，更別說把它搬上樓了。

sentences.english: Pangu open days soon, then, heaven and the earth is almost connected.
sentences.chinese: 盤古開天不久，那時，天和地差不多連着。

sentences.english: The quick plum chest starts to escape a cold idea and even became cold Mou sons.
sentences.chinese: 敏梅胸口竄起一股寒意，連眸子都變冷了。

sentences.english: I started walking down an unfamiliar road. There was not a soul there.
sentences.chinese: 我開始沿着一條不熟悉的道路前行，連個人影都沒有。

sentences.english: andeven those of their own instituting they frequently infringe.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連自己定下的規則也常常違背。

sentences.english: They tried yelling, even though it was hard to breathe.
sentences.chinese: 他們試着喊救命，儘管連呼吸都十分的困難。

sentences.english: Cao Zheng waiting to militia, stop von instructor Zhang Bingfei trial.
sentences.chinese: 曹政等人前往民兵連，阻止馮指導員審訊張秉飛。

sentences.english: I never even once saw a horse anywhere near the place.
sentences.chinese: 其實我在學校附近連一匹馬的影兒也沒見過。

definition: always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
